title: How to Make Baked Potatoes in a Halogen Oven

steps.title: Prepare the halogen oven.
steps.content: Prepare the halogen oven. Put the higher level stand in place. Most halogen ovens work best when there is the most airflow both above and below the food.

steps.title: Wash the potatoes.
steps.content: Wash the potatoes. Remove any imperfections.

steps.title: Pierce the potatoes.
steps.content: Pierce the potatoes. Poke a fork into various spots of each potato.

steps.title: Turn the temperature on the halogen oven to 200ºC.
steps.content: Turn the temperature on the halogen oven to 200ºC.

steps.title: Brush each potato with olive oil.
steps.content: Brush each potato with olive oil. Place in the oven evenly spaced apart. Do not have any potatoes touching.

steps.title: Cook for 45 minutes.
steps.content: Cook for 45 minutes. Test when the cooking ends. If they need more time, try another 10 to 15 minutes.

steps.title: Remove from the oven when done.
steps.content: Remove from the oven when done. Use tongs to lift out of the oven.

steps.title: Cut open the tops of each potato.
steps.content: Cut open the tops of each potato. Push a fork into the flesh and mash it around.

steps.title: Add a dollop of butter.
steps.content: Add a dollop of butter. Season with salt and pepper. Add anything else you'd like, such as grated cheese, baked beans, chopped tomatoes, etc.
